review.reviewBody: I had these Method goggles last year and am stoked to continue using them this year. Their interchangeable lens is easy to use and I love their color options. Definitely recommend!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: This goggle has a very comfy and snug fit and never ever fogs on me! I really love the design of it as well. Get this goggle!
review.name: Fits Perfectly!

review.reviewBody: The fit of the Methods are great, they aren't too tight but still keep the elements out, and great visibility. Once you learn how to change the lenses it's so easy, and can be done on the chair. I have three lenses for all levels of light. Highly recommend, and great look.
review.name: The perfect everday goggle

review.reviewBody: Love these goggles! They fit great on my face (not too big but also not restricting my vision). Ive never had my lenses fog (anywhere from Seattle to Europe to Japan). 10/10 totally got a pair for my girlfriend!
review.name: Great fit, look good, don't fog.

review.reviewBody:
I love the versatility of these goggles.

They fit great, have a minimal profile so they look great on, and they fit really well with just about any helmet. The lenses are pretty easy to change (I got these because my mag goggles would have lenses flying when I took big falls) and I have no issues with fogging thus far! 

would recommend!
review.name: Great go-to goggles

name: Method Goggles

review.reviewBody: These are really nice pants and fit me just like the model but run a full size small. In almost every brand I am a size 4/27, but I ordered a size 6 in these after reading the other reviews and they fit perfectly! They are really cute and feel well made.
review.name: Awesome (but size up)

review.reviewBody: Like another reviewer stated, the waist is very small. I never have a problem with waist size in a size 4 and these were way too tight. Other than that I would have loved them.
review.name: Waist is small

review.reviewBody: Over I love the pants— quality material, color, length. BUT the waistband is SO TIGHT. I ordered up (size 8 instead of 6 like I have in other stoic pants) and the are uncomfortably small in the waist. While the fabric has stretch the thread in the waistband doesn’t. Buy them, but size UP!
review.name: So close

review.reviewBody: I bought the teal and they fit so well. I'm a size 14, curvy girl and the wide leg hugs my figure. I decided to buy the brown sugar color too.
review.name: Love these pants!

review.reviewBody: I love these pants. I love the material. It's not too thin or too thick. The pants aren't too tight, which I appreciate very much. I'm 5'4, size 4, and small fit well. I will say the sizing varies slightly by color. The only negative is that there is a bit of extra material around the zipper area and pockets. And the price is a bit high.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: I cannot find shorts that fit me well. I really like these - perfect length, no silicone band to squeeze or sausage my cyclist quads, comfortable waistband. Unfortunately they are ruined by the useless stash pocket on the left leg that pulls the seaming out of line on one side. Who actually uses these pockets anyway? Sending another pair of shorts back.
review.name: Pocket ruined it for me

review.reviewBody: I bought a small and they fit but just a little snug in the crotch.  I will try the medium next time.  When I put them on I could heard the threads tearing a little bit.  I am 5'1" 120 lbs and like this short because of the 7.5 inseam length since I have short legs and a long torso.  They are meant for rides no longer than 20-30 miles.
review.name: Good Quality and Comfort

review.reviewBody: My wife loves these. She no longer complains about her bum hurting and she completely forgets she?s wearing them. Exactly what you want. It?s a great length
review.name: High quality and comfort

review.reviewBody:
I ride endurance road, gravel and mountain and i do a lot of bicycle touring as well. 
I purchased 8 pairs of shorts from Backcountry and plan to review all of them. I have never owned anyting from Garneau. Of the 8 pairs of shorts I ordered, these are in the top 3. The 7.5 lenghth on these is perfect. The fabric used for the shorts is soft, comfortable and a tad thicker compared to some of the other shorts I tried on. 
The fabric has "medium" compression.  There's pocket on the left side of the shorts for small items like lip balm, keys, sunscreen, etc. These are NOT see through and pass the squat test.These are a midrise short and while I prefer high rise, the waistband is extremely comfortable and fits over my hips without giving me muffin top. Full coverage in the back. In the end, i decided not to keep these but I think this is a great short and extremely comfortable. If these had a higher waist and came in an XS, I'd keep them. I will purchase from this brand in the future.
review.name: Comfortable and good quality

name: Fit Sensor 7.5 Short 2 - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Haldigrat Air HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this shell it is super versatile and has a good fit for my style. It super easy and comfortable to layer multiple layers underneath. The haldigrat has plenty of pockets and capability for anything you would need it for. I was previously ridding a Burton AK insulated coat and I’m glad I switched to this.
review.name: Mammut Haldigrat air HS hooded jacket

review.itemreviewed: Haldigrat Air HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I like the weight, fit, pockets and zippers on this jacket.
What I don’t like is how quickly the cuffs are wearing.  They are fraying after only about 5 days on the mountain.  I wear Swix and Hestra gloves which shouldn’t matter.
I had a Mountain Hardwear shell for over 20 years.  Maybe the lighter materials sacrifice durability…maybe a tougher material on the cuff would improve durability in that wear spot.
I like the jacket, I just don’t see it lasting as long as my old one.

review.itemreviewed: Haldigrat Air HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: If this jacket had hand pockets, I would give it a 10.
review.name: Great jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Haldigrat Air HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: The little I needed this jacket on my last trip was well worth it. Kept me dry, and the ventilation was great. Fits well. I got a medium and it fits well over my base layers and gives plenty of unrestricted moment still.
review.name: Great jacket

review.itemreviewed: Haldigrat Air HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Moving over from using Arc'teryx shells for the past 20 years, this shell is a change. In terms of fit, Arc'teryx shells tend to be hip length versus this shell that is a little longer and covers your posterior a little. The fit is also a little less fitted. In terms of sizing, I was recommended a Medium, but it was huge on me (very long in the arms, completely oversized hood, and way too much shoulder and wrist bulk.) A men's mall was the correct size. I'm 5'10" and 152 lbs for reference. The material on this shell is lighter than Arc'teryx hardshells.

The hood on this jacket is oversized and easily fits my helmet. It's actually a better hood than on Arc'teryx jackets. When fully zippered, the front of the jacket covers much higher than other shells and protects your mouth area entirely (I wish the inside material was a little softer around the mouth area--a detail that Arc'teryx would have nailed), which is great on windy days. However, when not fully zipped, the shell material is a little awkward around the neck/face area. When fully zipped, it offers better protection than my Arc'teryx shells and you can forgo using a face mask.

There are two large pockets on the chest area and one pass pocket on the left forearm as well as a phone pocket on the inside. Strangely, there are no side pockets on the front, which at first is strange, but there is plenty of pocket storage with the chest pockets and it's just something to get used to.

The zipper is a little catchy. I had to use some zipper lubricant to make it glide more easily. This too is a detail that Arc'teryx would have nailed better.

In terms of waterproofness, it did perform well in a snow/rain mix day. The water did soak into the material after an few hours, but it stayed on the surface and didn't get through to my midlayer. My sense is that this treatment is not as good as GoreTex or GoreTex Pro (water would not soak into my Arc'teryx after a few hours in the rain), but it's good enough unless you plan on skiing in the rain every day.

In terms of ruggedness, I took this shell in tight trees and got slapped by several branches and it didn't even leave marks on the shell, much less any damage. Seems pretty strong.

Overall, a very good jacket and given the price point compared to Arc'teryx, it's a good buy.
review.name: Solid jacket, but...

review.itemreviewed: Haldigrat Air HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This jacket is phenomenal. It’s lightweight but still cuts the wind and chill like it’s not even there. Very waterproof and comfortable. I’m 5’10” and 175 pounds and the large fits great. The only complaint I have is the lack of pockets on the outside of the jacket. There are two on each side of the zipper but no hand pockets at the bottom of the jacket. Other than that, it’s the perfect jacket.

review.itemreviewed: Haldigrat Air HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great jacket. Well made , super great for ski touring . A little weird that there's no lower front pockets but all in all great jacket

review.itemreviewed: Haldigrat Air HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Lightweight full featured mountain jacket. 
Used on some cold backcountry days and all conditions at resort.
review.name: A sweet jacket that's dry and visible to those trying to follow you.

review.itemreviewed: Haldigrat Air HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Haven't used this jacket yet but I was looking for something that looks good, is super breathable, and is waterproof enough for committing splitboard tours. Having tried (and been disappointed by) a lot of other shells I can say that this one *seems* like it will be perfect. It is lightweight, feels very breathable, and is super soft and comfortable for a hardshell. Great fit as well. If it is reasonably durable it will be a winner. 

I'm 5'7", 150 lbs and ordered a Medium. I like my shells reasonably baggy for splitboarding and a Medium is perfect. The sleeves are a bit long but when the cuff is cinched it doesn't matter. Would recommend a small if you're my size and like a tighter fit.

name: Haldigrat Air HS Hooded Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Gregory Kalmia 60L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Kalmia 60L Backpack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Kalmia 60L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This pack is so so comfortable and versatile. It has a pocket for everything and designed like a dream. Makes carrying a lot of weight on a weekend backpacking trip very comfortable and in the heat and humidity, that means the world. The material has held up wonderfully. I use this as my bag on vacations as well as for bavkpacking. The Gregory  3 liter reservoir works  great in it. I really love the suspension frame for any trip, but again, it’s so much nicer having it in the summer when it is so hot. Gregory bags are worth the investment and they never disappoint.
review.name: Gregory takes the cake!

review.reviewBody: This is a very good quality pack, the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that even with all it's adjustability I just couldn't get it to feel right so I returned it and got the Deva and am much happier with that one. For whatever reason I just find it more comfortable.
review.name: Just wasn't comfortable for me

review.reviewBody:
Bought this as a goft for my wife. Its a high quality pack. It's great for begins and intermediate backpackers. Its lightweight and durable material as well as a comfortable fit, everything needed in a pack. The only thing I'd say it's lacking is more pockets and dividers, but thats typical for the smaller size packs. It has the essentials but more would help me stay more organized out in the woods.
It's great as a 1-3 day hiking pack if your into minimalist camping. May be a little big to through on your back while snowboarding/skiing/biking but would still work.

Just bought my Kalmia 60- took it on an over night trip. Was comfortable to wear and easy to make adjustments to fit the body. Seems durable like it will last me for many trips to come. I liked the access pockets. I do feel I will have to strategically pack for multi day trips, maybe a 65 woulda been better choice for more room. Love the color and fact dirt didn't stick to it. Overall extremely happy with my purchase of the Kalmia after reviewing many other bags.
review.name: Very happy with my purchase of the Kalmia

review.reviewBody: I have not got to take it out yet but so far I love the comfort of it and the way the load sits.  The only downside that I wish it had was daisy chain on the front of the pack which for me would make it complete.
review.name: Perfect long weekend backpack

review.reviewBody: Excellent pack.  I have a short torso and this feels effortless, even when weighted up.

As someone who's petite (I'm 5'1" & ~140lbs), I find this pack to be very comfortable and easy to pack. I've now used this pack on four trips of varying length and elevation gain, from a 9-mile round-trip mostly flat two-day trip to a 12-mile round-trip with 2,500 ft elevation gain and loss two-day trip.  The only kind of trip I can't speak for is a multi-day longer than 2 days. I find that there aren't any hot spots for me and that the weight is really balanced if I put everything soft in the bottom of the bag, my bear barrel in the middle, and my tent on top. I attach my in-camp shoes and my camping chair to the bottom, and that seems to work well for me. I did buy the day pack that goes inside and that seems to work really well for holding my water blatter, and of course, being a day pack. I'm really happy with this pack, and I've already recommended it to a fellow backpacker who's gone out and bought one for herself! Keep hitting those trails folks! Enjoy!
review.name: Comfortable and easy to organise

review.reviewBody: I used this pack for a six-week backpacking trip through Africa, and I couldn’t have been happier with my choice of pack! The material held up really well with no visible wear and tear after being thrown on airplanes, buses, and the ground over and over again. I obviously expected my pack to get super dirty on a trip like this, but dirt and dust seemed to brush right off. The pack was easy to adjust and very comfortable; I have a small frame and used to always get bruises on my hip bones from my old backpack, but I didn’t have this issue with this backpack. I also loved the various pockets and that there were multiple ways to access the large compartment, which made it really easy to quickly find items without having to unpack the bag. I’m excited for many more adventures with this pack!
review.name: Comfortable, durable, versatile pack

review.reviewBody: Did a 28 mile hike with this pack, and it was great!  I love that the waist pockets are a little larger and they fit my phone.  The pockets in the pack are also well designed for staying organized.  I did wish I had paid attention to how the pack should fit.  My other pack was 15 year old, and I didn't realize that the newer pack design doesn't sit on your hips, it's designed to sit above.  I was much more comfortable once I figured this out.  The only thing lacking with this pack is a daypack option.
review.name: Love this backpack!

review.reviewBody:
I have the European version of this bag (if it's different) but one can't write a review on that website. 

Love it! Comfortable and easy to adjust. My previous backpacking bags weren't easy to adjust so it's great to finally have a properly fitted bag. Also, the free float system adds to the comfort which is again something I'd not gone across before. The water bottle holder is handy, as are the many  pockets for organisation. Hip belt pockets are a good size for holding phone etc and it came with a rain cover. 

Could've chosen a lighter rucksack but the extra features are worth the extra weight
review.name: Great bag!

name: Kalmia 60L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody:
PURCHASED THIS ASSUMING I WOULD RECEIVE THE WHITE COLOR BRA AS SHOWN IN ALL THE PRODUCT LISTING IMAGES - FLATS AND ON MODEL IMAGE SHOW THE WHITE BRA.

IT IS NOT WHITE

IT IS LIME GREEN

CHECK THIS WEBSITES LISTINGS VERY CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU PURCHASE OR VERIFY BEFORE YOU BUY.

TOTAL DISAPPOINTMENT CONSIDERING I HAD PLANNED TO WEAR IT FOR A RACE IN 4 DAYS.
review.name: ITEM LISTED IS NOT CORRECT - WRONG COLOR

review.itemreviewed: Twin Layer Medium Support Bra - Women's

Support? Check. Comfort? Check. Style? Check. 

Comfy, yet secure. Nothing worse than getting a sports bra that digs in all the wrong places during movement. This bra feels like a hug. It's been so long since I've bought a regular bra but hope this is helpful for the girlies: usually a 34B, got a size M and it fits perfect.
review.name: Divine 11/10

review.itemreviewed: Anthem Round Toe Shortie Western Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots go great with a variety of outfits.  I’ve worn with jeans, skirts both long and short.  One problem is they do have to be worn in. review.itemreviewed: Anthem Round Toe Shortie Western Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] When I say I LOVE these boots, you don’t know how much. I bought these boots mainly for work but they go so well with some of my outfits, so I started wearing them out. Also they are super comfy and I also like to ride in them.
review.name: Love them!!!

review.itemreviewed: Anthem Round Toe Shortie Western Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like these boots! Wore them all day at a livestock show, first time wearing them, and they were already comfy and didn’t feel like they needed breaking in. I would definitely order these again
review.name: Love these boots!

review.itemreviewed: Anthem Round Toe Shortie Western Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been on the lookout for a shorter pair of cowboy boots. I was not blessed with feet that allow for a pointy toe type boot or calves that look good in a taller boot. Then I saw these and loved them. I ordered my normal shoe size (9.5) and they fit like a glove. I am so happy with my purchase, and they have become my almost everyday footwear.
review.name: Great and comfortable boot.

review.itemreviewed: Anthem Round Toe Shortie Western Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are now my go-to shoes for walking days. They’re the most comfortable shoes I’ve ever worn! Used them as travel shoes and didn’t get any blisters or pressure points like I usually do with any other shoes. I’ve so glad I purchased these.
review.name: Most comfortable shoes I’ve ever worn!

review.itemreviewed: Anthem Round Toe Shortie Western Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable boot that I was able to wear for a night out on the town right away. Good quality that I expected will hold up for a long time.
review.name: Love this boot!

name: Anthem Round Toe Shortie Western Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great hanging shelf but with there was a different kind of attachment style to hook onto tent pockets instead of having to hook it onto the middle loop. Was also smaller than i expected but that was my bad for not checking the measurements. Overall a great addition!
review.name: great addition

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Finally bought one of these; very pleased with it.   No matter the plan, the attempts at order, the usage of space, the this, the that; the whatever; the inside of the VW Westy is simply CHRONIC tiny in so many ways!
This does well with getting spices, phone, lights, wallet, etc; up off of surfaces; and soooo OUT OF THE WAY.
Love it; glad I finally got one.  :)
review.name: Making space in the camp space!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Marmot Birdhouse 3-Shelf Hanging Tent Organizer is a durable and versatile addition to any camping trip. It's easy to hang and has ample storage space for camping essentials. Its compact size makes it convenient to pack away. Highly recommended for outdoor enthusiasts.
review.name: Organize Camping Gear with Marmot Birdhouse

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sadly didn’t read dimensions so it was a bit smaller than I was expecting. But seems well made and will be a plus for camping with glasses that I’ll need to easily get. Better option than telling yourself you’ll remember where your headlamp is ha
review.name: Nice addition for the small need to get items

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was surprised how much use this got on our first campout with it.  Great way to add some space in the tent.
review.name: Really convenient

review.reviewBody: The Birdhouse Tent Organizer is not as long as I thought, but then I will be able to use it in all my tents from 4 person to my 1 person. My only complaint is that it has no way to secure it once it is collapsed down for storage. Needs a small bag or elastic to secure.  Don't care for the light holder at the bottom, it really just needs a hanging loop on bottom. If you have different loops in your tents, you can hang it on a side or corner. I got the three shelf, because the one shelf was not available. Hope the one shelf comes back. Good shelf for keeping items organized. Seems very well made.
review.name: Handy! Even without Birds.

name: Birdhouse 3-Shelf Hanging Tent Organizer

description: Buy the Sidi Dominator 10 Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dominator 10 Cycling Shoe - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sidi Dominator 10 Cycling Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: As usual Siri quality is outstanding from top to bottom. However, the redesigned heel tread is lopsided and constantly causes you to turn an ankle outwards. It is quite annoying and potentially dangerous. The BOA closure knobs and confusing to flip open and cannot be adjusted while riding. I plan to somehow mark the knobs so I know which side to flip up. The uppers are totally bombproof and are not affected by occasional immersion in streams. The sole, while not carbon, is stiff enough for excellent power transfer.
review.name: Outstanding quality but a bit tipsy!

review.reviewBody:
I had a an older pair of Sidi shoes and wanted to get a new pair.  I knew my size and the Sidi chart is spot on.  Normally a 46 in European sizing but with Sidi I need to go up one full size to 47 normally a size 12 US.  The dual BOA system has worked great and seems to make the upper conform better to my foot than the velcro system on my older shoes.  Shoes vent really well being here in the high desert is a must and my high arch insoles fit perfectly.

They fit perfect right out of the box with zero break in.
review.name: Great Shoes for the MTB

review.reviewBody:
I replaced my worn out dominator 7 style Sidis with the 10 model. I think the dual tightening mechanism system is worth the extra $ over the dominator 7?s. By the time my old pair reached the end of their useful life, the Velcro was pretty gone. The tightening mechanism on the 10 model takes a little time to put on, but the adjustment is very precise. Exiting is fast.
The 10 model is made in Italy, great fit. Size 45 fit my US size 11 feet just right.
review.name: Excellen
comment:
Hey Scott,

Thanks for the great review! Happy to hear that you're loving the shoes.

review.reviewBody: very comfortable, very roomy, the adjustments on them are easy to use and the simple color combination that Sidi continues to use are appealing.
review.name: Love them

name: Dominator 10 Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is an improvement from previous generation NanoFlex which I soaked through on a rainy ride last year. I threw water on these and it beaded up and fell off. Sizing is fine. I have XL and generally use XL in Castelli, Assos and Craft. I need 2XL in Castelli tights for my long legs/shorter torso 73.5”, 200 lbs frame. They were not too short for me.  I tried putting Nikwax Tx direct waterproofing on the old ones, but it didn’t help. Happy trails; hope this is useful.
review.name: 3G NanoFlex is better than predecessor

review.reviewBody: Just wore these in 40 F weather here in CT.  Kept my knees/legs reasonably warm. ISSUE is these slid down from the top of my thighs to below my knees after 6-7 minutes of pedaling!  Pulled them up repeatedly and they continued to slide down past my knees!  Yes, these are sized correctly as I am 6'1", 182#, bought size XL.  Very snug at calf and snug on my thighs but continue to slide down my bib shorts...Very frustrating, would not recommend these. thnks
review.name: Castelli Nano flex Leg warmers

review.reviewBody: I Bought them a month ago And I love them.
review.name: Leg warmers

review.reviewBody: Normally, I am only motivated to write reviews of merchandise that I truly love or hate. That's the case here. I love these for their comfort, fit, quality, and warmth. Additionally, as with any cycling cold-weather gear, it is important to be able to peel it off and stow it as the day warms up. In this part of the country, we ride the entire year. In spring, fall and winter we are almost always COLD at the start and often HOT at the end of the ride. That's why these are a more practical purchase than insulated knickers or insulated tights -for me anyway.  Others have complained about the zipper rubbing a sore spot on their ankle. I have never had that problem.
review.name: Warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Castelli gear isn't cheap. But I've tried a lot of leg warmers over the years and none do the job as well as the Castelli Nano Flex 3G. I have three pairs (rotation) and they're my "go to" accessory for mid-Fall to late-Spring. Sure, if serious winter temps arrive, they may not be enough, but last year nano-flex warmers got a workout Nov-Mar.  And I especially appreciate how well they stay up too. Entering my second full season with them...
review.name: Deserves their reputation...

name: Nano Flex 3G Leg Warmer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use it to go running when it's cold outside; alone, it's not enough, but with a t-shirt underneath, it keeps warm up to the freezing point. It's just slightly too big for me, but a cycle in the drying machine made the fit a smidge better. The collar is a little annoying; it's a little too big, but I don't want to open it so the cold can sneak in.
review.name: Overall, pretty great!

review.reviewBody: Love it! Love everything wool. Irish sweaters. Hand knit socks. Love all my Icebreaker clothing. Perfect fit. Tried to shrink after losing weight. Machine washed. Hot dryer. Most wool felts and shrinks with anything other than handwashing. Not this. Wore this half-zip all winter. Seemed like every day for 8 yrs before replacing. Price tag a bit ouchy.
review.name: Comfortable enough to wear every day!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This most recent 260 purchase demonstrates the Icebreaker is making changes for the better. I own several 260's already from past years. This newest shirt has what appears to be a somewhat different weave. It is softer and even more comfortable. It is immediately noticeable and very pleasant. One caveat: I usually wear a size large in Icebreaker, but the Large size here was too big. I exchanged for a medium, which fit precisely. Can't go wrong otherwise.
review.name: Great shirt with a few positive and noticeable changes

review.reviewBody: Caveat emptor: I own two Icebreakers and on both the ink from the label inside the back collar comes off on my skin. I get a black tattoo every time I wear the shirt. I finally put tape over it but of course it comes off eventually. Great quality otherwise but this label problem is a disaster.
review.name: Beware the ink from the label

name: Merino 260 Tech Long-Sleeve 1/2-Zip Top - Men's

review.reviewBody:
No joke.  I bought my first pair my senior year of high-school when my brother worked for Erehwon (remember Erehwon?!?).  Two years ago, after some big Colorado hikes I decided it was time for a new pair, mainly becuase as I've gotten older my feet have "spread" a bit and I now wear almost a full size larger.  So, it wasn't that my original Sundowners fell apart (they were still supporting my feet) but that I needed more room.
I got the suede pair this time around, and they are just as great.  I hike multiple days a week near my home, and try for a few big trips a year.  This past year was the highlands in Scotland. My sundowners were great.  
Two things I recommend to people who are complaining about toes.  Yes, these boots can be a bit snug initially.  It's always a good idea to plan some toe-box room and order up a size with these.  These boots will conform to your feet over time because they are leather.  Which is FANTASTIC for fit and durablility.  (see above re: 32 years).
Also, I have always put a pair of Superfeet soles in my boots, Sundowners included.  I believe these help not just with support, but in keeping my feet from sliding too far into the toe box on decents.
review.name: bought my second pair.... after 32 years

review.itemreviewed: Taiss Light ML Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: High-quality, great fit. I buy it over and over again

review.itemreviewed: Taiss Light ML Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is a fantastic mid-layer for the backcountry. Sheds plenty of heat, but keeps you warm at the same time. I typically will skin up in this layer during colder days, because it’s a touch too warm to use every single day out there. But I find myself choosing this piece over other layering options the majority of the time.

review.itemreviewed: Taiss Light ML Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Super comfortable mid layer, breathable, light so if I remove it and throw in a pack I don't have to carry much
review.name: Taiss backcountry Ski mid layer jacket

review.itemreviewed: Taiss Light ML Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: It could be thicker, but it's hard to tell by the photos.  Overall a great lightweight jacket.
review.name: Perfect for what I was looking for

review.itemreviewed: Taiss Light ML Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very light mid layer with good airspace. Cut is pretty fitted, 5'10" 165 lbs 42" chest and medium fits properly.
review.name: great light mid layer

review.itemreviewed: Taiss Light ML Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Light enough to wear indoors, but warm enough to to wear in transitional seasons on its own, or as a layer in cold weather.  Well constructed and soft.
review.name: Lightweight Warmth

review.itemreviewed: Taiss Light ML Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought the Taiss Light as a "replacement" for my 8+ year-old Mammut Mercury hoody. The Mercury has been my favorite hoody since I bought it. It's still going strong but has become my wife's favorite too so it frequently disappears. The Taiss's fit is snugger, but every bit as comfortable as the Mercury. It will be great as a mid-layer this ski season and for cooler days on the crag. The hood fits comfortably under my ski and climbing helmets. I do like the thumbholes, a feature my Mercury does not have. Great piece of gear that's also perfect for everyday wear.
review.name: Perfect Midlayer

review.itemreviewed: Taiss Light ML Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Great and well fitting midlayer! Moves well under shells or other layers.
I wear medium in US brands and large in European ones and this one follows this trend. Consider sizing up if you don't want it to be too snug.
Zippers on European brands are on the opposite side of Americans but easy to figure out
review.name: Great midlayer - and oh so comfy!

review.itemreviewed: Taiss Light ML Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Really nice hooded mid layer. Soft material, fits in well with other layers

review.itemreviewed: Taiss Light ML Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Perfect fit for a base layer. Hugs and stretches in all the right places. And with longer sleeves, it allows you to reach without exposing your wrists. Nice to wear as just a slim fit for brisk morning climbs.

name: Taiss Light ML Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I got a new bike that needed a 50mm stem and this Orange colored I9 - 318 stem was on sale. I would of bought it off sale anyway. They just fit so well, look so good and have the best polished edges and thick anodized finish around! Light too! I've got a 40mm on another bike and it's bullet proof after 2 years of hard riding.
review.name: Love the I9 Stems!

review.reviewBody: It's Industry Nine, so expect something strong, well engineered and beautiful.  Granted, it's a bit pricey and there are other cheaper stems that will just just as good a job, but I always choose to support small American businesses whenever I can.  In a way, this stem is fancy bike bling, but it's also of the highest quality and will probably last you a lifetime.
review.name: Top notch American craftsmanship ...

review.reviewBody: Well designed and manufactured.  Fit is perfect and it?s plenty stout.  It looks amazing.  No complaints about it.
review.name: Beautiful Piece of Bike Art

review.reviewBody:
I bought the 30 mm stem in black, to reduce reach compared to a 50 mm stock stem. It's a great stem on all performance fronts.

It looks great (which is obviously subjective); it's both blocky and curved, and looks like there's no material that isn't needed. The text and decals are simple, and less in-your-face than many other stems.

As is to be expected, it is sturdy; it's 30 mm long after all. I didn't have any flex from the longer stem either, and I haven't noticed any difference in vibration or chatter between the two lengths. The steering feels great: fast and responsive, but not twitchy on this bike. The most noticeable change is the 20 mm reach reduction, which is exactly what I wanted. I'm slightly more upright now , but I can still weight the front if needed, which it is... the local climbs are very steep.

So it's a great product, but it is expensive. I don't have the experience to comment on whether it is better than the similarly sized $100 stems out there.
review.name: Solid piece of kit

name: A318 Stem

hasVariant.name: Sierra Glove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Icebreaker Sierra Glove online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Glove liner while hunting, driving SxS, and working outdoors. No smells. Not as warm as I had hope. Works well as long as you never allow your hands to get cold from touching metal.
review.name: I would buy again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These gloves are warm and comfortable. I wear them every day driving to the gym, running errands. Love how they clip togethr.
review.name: Wonderful everyday gloves

review.reviewBody: I love the RealFleece inside. But When I buy gloves like this, supposedly with grippiness, I want gloves that actually DO have good gripping power in wet or dry conditions! I want to be able to grab a wet ski pole or a snowy cup and have it actually grip well. These don't have enough grip and the grip does not cover enough of the palm. The grip fabric also needs to *extend to fingers and thumb*!!! What's the point of putting any grip on the gloves if it doesn't work?!?!
review.name: Please cover more of the palm & fingers w/better suede

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was hoping these gloves were going to keep my hand warm while biking during the winter, but they are more like liners to wear under another pair of gloves in case of really cold temperature. The fit is perfect and the quality as well.
review.name: Hoped to be warmer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] usually, even size XSl is too large for me. this one fits! like a "glove"
review.name: great gloves

review.reviewBody: The pair I ordered had a thumb which was as long as the longest fingers. The rest of my fingers fit but the thumb sleeve was absurdly long. I have normal shaped hands.
review.name: Thumb strangely long

review.reviewBody: I didn't believe the reviews that indicated rips at seams and small  holes appearing.  Icebreaker makes the best wool stuff around.  I use these gloves simply to keep my hands warm on outdoors runs.  It's still cold here and I'm still wearing these gloves.  Three months and a wash or two later, these things look like they are two years old:  pilled everywhere and a hole between the fingers.  Will be starting a warranty claim.  Terrible use of good money.
review.name: Pills and Rips Easily

review.reviewBody: I received these gloves three months ago. They aren?t warm enough for cold Colorado nights. But, I like that they are slim enough to function as liners under my ski gloves. I was shocked when I put them on today and discovered holes in two finger tips. As liners, they aren?t exposed to anything, and my nails are short, so I don?t know how two holes could have developed with such little use. Money wasted.
review.name: Fragile indeed

review.reviewBody: Great dexterity with these and perfect weight for cool weather biking, though the palms and fingers have only light grip. The only problem is that a hole tore along a seam near my palm only a month of using them. Maybe I put too much stress on them from stretching the fingers to reach the brakes on my drop bars.
review.name: Really warm & thin, but fragile

name: Sierra Glove

review.reviewBody: We have been looking for indoor shoes for our pre-K age daughter to where in her classroom. We wanted the shoes to be breathable and flexible so her feet can develop while still meeting the school’s requirements for shoes. These checked out boxes and so far our daughter loves the color and says they are comfortable and easy to get on and off!
review.name: Perfect indoor school shoes for my daughter

review.reviewBody: I think I got a size too big for my daughter but she will grow into it
review.name: I think I got a

review.reviewBody: Great quality. Fits a big bigger, so keep that in mind. The material really is water resistant.
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: 3 YO can put on by himself! Green color is perfect
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: It's an awkward shape and the hard plastic in the front hurts my daughter's toes
review.name: Doesn't fit correctly

review.reviewBody: my daughter loves these shoes. They are easy on/off, durable, and comfortable! will be buying again.
review.name: perfect

review.reviewBody:
I bought two pairs one for my grandson and one for myself, and we love them.
He wears a 9 1/2 and other shoes and we had to go up to a size 10
I usually wear a 7 1/2 and tennis shoes and I had to go down to5 5 1/2
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: These shoes have been the best! They are easy to put on/take off, they don’t require socks (if you have a kiddo like mine on the spectrum) and that wide front toe space is helpful when he’s running. He loves these shoes! He’s a picky guy and he has asked to wear these all year round. Also - easily washable! Literally perfect!
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: Super easy to put on. Very good quality. Super light. And wide so kids feet don't get squeezed. Love it!
review.name: My kids love it!

review.reviewBody:
My child loved the color and comfort.
The easy elastic lacing was easy to put on for school shoes. The grippy sole is great for physical education class. The stretchy mesh shoe material is great for flexible foot movement . The toe box could be a little more wider for better toe splay when active for a wider toe box that my daughter has. A challenge in finding narrow heal and wider toe splay footwear. 
I would definitely recommend to all ages who have a more narrow foot.
review.name: Good breathable shoe

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Scree 33L Backpack - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I spend 40-50 hours a week surveying rugged terrain and having a good, comfortable pack is very important to me. This pack it great and I’m glad I got it.  It is very ergonomic and in the internal frame holds the weight well so that the strain stays off my back. I have plenty of room in the pack to bring all my equipment. The gear loops on the waist strap is very functional and helps me keep my gear at hand.
review.name: Sturdy and comfortable

review.reviewBody:
I picked this up a month ago after doing a ton of research. I love how stripped down, but functional it is. The new material gives it some structure, and it feels burly compared to other packs I've used. Love the tri-zip, and the accessibility of gear is top-notch.

I took it on a trip to Red Rocks outside of Vegas and it was a dream for the approach. It carries weight well, and the adjustable fit is nice to dial things in. Once things got scrambly or technical, it was annoying to look up since the internal frame stay is so rigid and runs right across the top of the pack. I felt like a turtle. Running it frameless was uncomfortable too. Once I got home, I bent the top of the stay to give my head and helmet a little bit of space, and it felt a million times better. 

I wish it had a similar shoulder strap setup to the Gallagator / Bridger series with the soft flask pockets. The accessories to add that feature are awesome, but they add some bulk to an already thick strap. Would be cool if I was able to swap out the harness for one with the pockets integrated. All in all, it's still an excellent pack, and I'm excited to have it.
review.name: Pretty close to my ideal alpine climbing pack.

review.reviewBody:
Got this bag after considering a Hyperlite and Mountain Hardware pack for car-to-car alpine summit pushes. This pack has delivered on what I was looking for: tough, water resistant, can hold mountaineering tools (axe, picket, rope, etc.), and big enough to carry my sizeable 10 essentials.

-The zippers are big and easy to pull with gloves on. 
-Side straps can be added, moved, subtracted based on exterior carrying needs.
-Wish it had an exterior rear dump pocket for dropping crampons/microspikes in while they melt and dry out on the hike down.
(This is not really a backpacking overnight pack).
review.name: Great Alpine Summit Pack

review.reviewBody:
I had been wanting to get a Mystery Ranch pack for a few years now.  the Scree 33L filled a gap in my pack setup.  I'm so glad I got this bag!  

My body tends to be picky when it comes to packs.  This pack fit perfectly right out of the box.  Should adjustment be necessary, the pack height is adjustable.  I've taken this pack on a few day hikes loaded up with gear for my dogs and myself, and it's now my favorite pack.  Zero hot spots, easy adjustments while wearing, and the most comfortable pack I own.

Contents are easily accessible in the large main compartment - the bag splits open with the center zipper.  The material shed a rain shower and kept the interior contents dry.  Waterproof zippers help protect the contents.

I'm looking forward to buying my second Mystery Ranch pack in the future.  This bag has made me a huge fan.
review.name: Super comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Be aware that most 
 reviews are for the old version, Scree 32L, not the new 33L. The redesign has a number of changes (materials, zippers, straps) and should have its own seperate reviews. The new bag also cost a hundred dollars more. Old version was a great "one bag travel bag" and I will not be paying more for the newer version.
review.name: New bag, old reviews

review.reviewBody: This is my first pack from Mystery Ranch and WOW! The zipper construction and shell materials are insanely durable - exactly what I want during nasty approaches and ascents. The top feature for me is the three-way zippered main compartment. It allows me to open the pack fully and not only access more gear without taking it out, but offers a better ability to organize it in the first place. The external straps are plenty long to allow secure carrying of all sorts of gear. The hip belt and sternum strap provide great comfort while the load-lifter straps on the shoulders allow the fit to be even more dialed. The top pocket is plenty large for wallet/keys/phone/snacks etc. Regarding sizing, I would have gone with a Large had it been in stock, but the XL works great! It will probably be more advantageous during ice season when extra layering is needed. Last but not least, the limeade color with black trim looks so good in person!
review.name: Convenience Built Tough!

review.reviewBody:
I am impressed at how much you can load inside this pack. I can fit multiple jackets, helmet, cramp on, small camera, water, crampons, and carry my axe and poles on the outside. And it fits very comfortably. The annoying thing is, the buckles are weak. One broke the moment i took it out of the box and test load my gear. And these are not easy to replace buckles. Another small annoying detail are the zipper pulls. They are too small for glove use. Luckily these are easy to replace, which I did with larger paracord and shrink tubbing. 
Over all it's a fantastic backpack, with a couple of small flaws.
review.name: Great mountaineer pack. With a couple of annoying

review.reviewBody: I’ve used this a little so far. For an assault pack sized pack it does an amazing job. I’ve taken it with me on multiple hikes and I actually just got back from a three day trip to Channel Islands. If you check out SamTheOddMan on YouTube you’ll see me walking around with it. The frame felt solid and the material is durable although I haven’t been beating like I would if I was still in the military. If you think you’ll be falling and sliding down a lot from bad terrain I would recommend a military pack but for relaxing to moderate hikes and outdoor ventures this is an amazing pack!
review.name: Worth the dough

review.reviewBody:
I bought this backpack after for light weight, durability, medium size bag and the “Y” shape zipper. This was for the intention of being mobile while saddle hunting. By far, BEST backpack I’ve had. The material is tough and SUPER light weight. The bag fit my Tethrd Predator XL platform (in the predator case) perfectly. I split two climbing sticks per side of the bag. I’ve also was able to store my Tethrd saddle in the backpack with the platform after the hunting seasons. Everything I needed for saddle hunting goes into one bag for storage. I’m amazed by this bag.

Suggestions: On the lower right and left side of the bag, maybe put a strap on it so either it can secure the lower side of maybe climbing sticks, elk tube, trekking poles.
review.name: Perfect light bag for saddle hunting

review.reviewBody:
I've owned the Scree for about 1.5 years now. It's an awesome pack for Search and Rescue, and my favorite pack that I own. Using it brings me joy.

 Some observations:
-the low profile doesn't snag or catch when pushing through brush
-the heavy duty material withstands a LOT of abuse and still looks good
-tri-zip allows me to get rapid access to anything I need
-Daisy chains allow for effective lashing
-the pack stiffens as it gets fuller. The more that's in it, the more comfortable it gets
-32L is enough for a basic survival kit & SAR loadout, about perfect for a low angle 24 hour pack 

Cons:
-At 32L, there isn't a great place for bulky items, so there's a lot of packing and repacking when you have items like a helmet
-The load bearing is fantastic, but at 32L... You're never gonna be able to load enough to stress the pack. It's a little overkill.
-the gear loops on the Daisy chains could be a little bigger along the bottom. They're big enough for poles, but just a few more inches of fabric would add a lot of versatility (rope, pad, etc)
-no good place to hook a flashlight or knife to the waist belt.

Overall, the pack is one or two external gear loops away from my perfect pack. Strongly recommend.
review.name: Awesome SAR pack

name: Scree 33L Backpack - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Title says it all. I have a Beal Joker 9.1 and just opened the Opera 8.5 and thought "these weight the same?". I took the time to weigh the rope on two different scales and it came in at ~8.5 lbs. For 70m that is ~55 g/m way more than the 48 g/m advertised. Maybe the rope is actually 80m long? That would make the math work out..... not going to uncoil it and measure though.

UPDATE: And I figured out the reason for this. Per Mountain Project at least. "As I and "SteveF" mentioned, the official way (IUAA?, EC?) used by manufacturers to measure rope weight per meter is to take a piece (?? how long, but probably about 2 to 3 meters) hang a 10kg weight from it for 1 minute. This puts some stretch in the rope. ( but less than the "% elongation" percentage, which is done with 80kg).

THEN, mark a 1 meter length, then cut rope at the marks, and weigh the "1 meter" piece.

The cut piece will, once it "returns" to its "normal un-stretched length", will be slightly shorter than 1 meter, and thus will weigh slightly less (in g/m) than a meter of "un-stretched" rope, i.e. the g/m arrived at by weighing the rope and dividing by its length in meters, whether the nominal meter length on the label, or the actual length as determined by measuring it on the ground."
review.name: Weighs 55 g/m not the 48 g/m spec

review.reviewBody: We have been using these ropes extensively at my guide service and have been amazed at the durability and lasting water repellency. I have also used this rope personally climbing everywhere from thousands of feet of granite rock climbing in Patagonia to long ice climbs in Alaska and wet climbs on Mt baker. It excels in all areas where weight and supple handling is a priority. It will be my go to climbing rope for a long time.
review.name: Best alpine rope

name: Opera Golden Dry Climbing Rope - 8.5mm

review.itemreviewed: AK Baker Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a lightweight but warm puffer that could be versatile enough for my variety of outdoors activities, and this one is absolutely perfect! I wanted something lightweight and warm that I could use for backpacking/snow-shoeing, but also as an extra layer when I'm snowboarding in negative temps. 
The pit zips are larger than any other jacket I've ever owned, and are easy to access zipping down AND up even with my thick gloves on. 
This jacket is so light, it hardly feels like I'm wearing an extra layer, and I don't feel it in my pack when it's stuffed away. The lightness of this jacket doesn't take away from it's all encompassing warmth, it's so cozy, I end up leaving off all my other layers and am cozy enough just in my base layer and this most of the time!
Also. The colour. I am obsessed! It can be difficult to find colours that aren't just the neutrals/earth tones and the stark primary colours in a lot of outdoor wear so this was an amazing find for me! 
Lastly, I have to mention how impressed and amazed I am with Backcountry! I ordered this on a Friday, very tempted to get overnight shipping because of a snowshoeing backpacking trip I was going to leave for on the following Monday but decided against it since it was practically the weekend and there was just no possible way for it to arrive before I left. *Almost* decided to drive 20 miles to Eldora to snag one from a shop there with a huge markup but decided to hold off and resolved to enjoy it on my next excursion. Lo' and behold, it arrived very early on Sunday morning via standard shipping. Such a great experience shopping through Backcountry! Thank you!
review.name: Beyond perfect!

name: AK Baker Down Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody:
There are for the 4D MAG S.  S is a small frame.  

For the standard frame, look for the 4D MAG without the S.  As far as I can tell Backcountry.com doesn't carry them.

They are great lenses however.
review.name: Don't be fooled by "One-Size"

review.reviewBody: No issues here, great to add a third lens to my set to have storm, sun, and now mid, all covered.

review.reviewBody:
So even thou these state ONE SIZE, there are actually two sizes of these googles.  So make sure you get the correct Lens Size.

This is cut from the ad:    

Color:
ChromaPop Storm Rose Flash

Size:
One Size

This is printed on the lens:

4D MAG S Goggles Replacement Lens,        Notice the 
S    the regular size has the same exact printing minus the S
review.name: the "s" means small

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love these pants. The material is soft and stretchy, but feels durable. The waist fits perfectly for the size and the belt system is neat. But, They are the most baggy pants in the seat that I have ever tried on. From the back, it looks like I'm carrying a stuff sack in the seat. I've marked that they fit true to size based on the waist and the length, but it's not true for the seat. I have to return them.
review.name: Great pants, but...

review.reviewBody: I like these pants but I should have gotten a 28 waist. Also the description on this page mentions a webbing loop you can use to cinch the waist, which doesn't exist on the pants I got. That's a reference to a slightly different article number that uses the same name. I'm considering having the pants modified to fit better because I like the color and materials otherwise.
review.name: Runs big, item description is wrong

review.reviewBody: These Vans look very cool and are very warm, however, they run a bit small and narrow; my suggestion would be to get the next size up or a half size up.
review.name: Vans for the Winter

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my 11 y.o son. He wears a men size 6.5. I bought size 7 because these run a bit snugged. He wears all his sneakers out. Since I always buy these type of vans for his dad. I thought let us try for our son. He loves then. They are comfortable and durable. I love the outersole. It is strong and supportive with it's ridges. He wears them in the rain and snow. His feet remains warm and dry. Also, love buying from this store. They ship quickly and customer service is great.
review.name: Amazing  sneakers

review.reviewBody: These are far too small at my normal size. I would recommend going up a full size. I can't wear these and since it costs $7 to send back to Back Country I will be reselling them locally.
review.name: Too Small

review.reviewBody: Got the all black ones for my husband. they fit perfect and are his go-to casual shoe. good quality sneaker. looks like high top sneakers and not a boot.
review.name: Great sneaker

review.reviewBody: The inside of the toe box is lumpy and hard, pushing into the top of my smaller toes, causing immediate discomfort, fits fine otherwise. Its probably a defect, but maybe they're all like this. I wouldn't waste time on these shoes
review.name: Bizarre lumps in toe box hurt

review.reviewBody: This shoe looks great and feels well made, but I'm returning mine as the toe box is way too tight even with thin socks on. If you're looking to wear these in cold weather with midweight socks for warmth, I'd say order at least a half size up (maybe even a full size).
review.name: Great looking shoe but not true to size

review.reviewBody:
These shoes are fantastic. I needed something for wearing with jeans that has solid traction for work (I'm in roofing) as well as in the rain and in slick conditions. The MTE-1 outsole is aggressive without becoming a trip hazard, and they are warm without roasting your feet. As far as eye candy, they're incredibly good looking and can be worn with most outfits and don't look out of place.

Regarding the feel of them, they're very secure and tightness is easily adjusted with the laces. They don't bind in any area along the laces, and the higher top keeps them under your pant legs. The all-black with the gum colored sole makes these very versatile, and I'm now looking at a low top one for wear with shorts.

Highly recommend!!
review.name: Amazing and a great buy

review.reviewBody:
The black with white thread look VERY sharp, much better in person. These remind me of my old nike 6s, but even better, with a cleaner design and sharper contrast, and vans style. They were awesome and dry on a rainy windy florida day.

SIZE: got these in 10. They are a little tight around the top front of the foot. For reference, I comfortably wear a 9.5 in vans Era Pro skate, and the standard vans slip-on in 10 is almost too loose on me. 

if I would have gotten a 10.5 in these, it would have been the equivalent feel of the era pro size 9.5. 

I normally wear 9.5/10 in vans, these you need to size up half a size.
review.name: Look awesome, Feel awesome

review.reviewBody: Got them for my boyfriend and he loves them . super comfy and looks great with jeans .
review.name: Good Looking Shoe

review.reviewBody: These are NOT green. Bought them as a gift in the grape leaf and they look nothing like the photo! The stock photo is an obvious bright olive green - but in real life they're more like a green-tinged bluish-black.  There's no way these shoes are passing off as green to anyone who buys them. Plus, the suede is cut super sloppy with uneven trim and sections where the inner felt lining sticks out past where the leather should have been sewn. I don't see how these could possibly have passed quality control - it's just sad. The sizing was as expected but they look so cheap it's not even worth the comfort. Returning ASAP.
review.name: Super disappointed

name: UltraRange Exo Hi MTE-1 Shoe

hasVariant.name: Luxe Towel

hasVariant.name: Luxe Towel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Packtowl Luxe Towel online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Grand Canyon rapids expedition for 8 days.  This towel was great.  Light weight.  Easy to pack.  Most importantly it dries very quickly even just draped over tree limbs!
review.name: As advertised!

review.reviewBody: It’s perfect. I only wish there was a smaller version offered in a four pack. I play tennis and have to wash mine almost every day.
review.name: Great for sports gear.

review.reviewBody: This is a great size to dry one or two people off after a dip in a river and still small enough to pack. Also dries very quick
review.name: perfect for backpacking

review.reviewBody: First use. Didn’t dry very well compared to other similar products.
review.name: Slow Drying

review.reviewBody:
Amazing!
After years of using a more compact version, I treated myself with this. I can finally dry my whole body and hair (and I’m a very tall guy) and the towel still feels like it could soak in more. It’s three times the volume of my compact one, but I’m ready to accept that because it’s five times better. Plus, it’s so smooth.

Also saved my day!
Feminine colleagues got into the wrong locker at the office’s gym on their first day. Thankfully, this towel was big enough to wrap around my waist.
review.name: MVP

review.reviewBody: I just wanted something to throw in the back of my truck that was quick drying, durable, and big enough to share if I absolutely had to. The full sized Luxe seems to check all those boxes. I have other more packable towels for backpacking and river trips. This one is far more absorbent and feels better on my skin. Good towel, would recommend.
review.name: It’s a towel

review.reviewBody: It's been great! Absorbs a bit better than the normal microfiber, and the size increase isn't too bad for the extra plushness and absorption
review.name: Solid!

review.reviewBody: This is not the lightweight, super compact, quick drying towel I thought it was.
review.name: Not what I thought

review.reviewBody:
I got the beach size and it's a great size for laying down on while still packing up tiny into the provided pouch. I used it at the park which had pretty dried-up grass, and unfortunately the microfiber material picked up all the tiny twigs and grass stems and they didn't shake out. I washed and dried it several times and even went over it with a rubber pet brush, but it's still got little bits all over it. 
so be warned, this would probably be a great towel for indoors or the beach, but I wouldn't use it for grassy areas or camping.
review.name: Don't use it on grass!!

review.reviewBody: Made very well, good technology. Efficient - you can use one for about a week for a bath towel, plus they take less energy to wash/dry.
review.name: Made very well, good technology.

name: Luxe Towel

review.itemreviewed: Kor AirShell Wind Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Super light, super soft on touch. I always have it in my backpack when I hike in the mountains. Even when it’s hot outside, on the top of a mountain there’s often chill wind and this hoody comes in handy. Didn’t have any problems with it in a light rain but when there’s actual rain in the forecast I always bring with me waterproof jacket also.

review.itemreviewed: Kor AirShell Wind Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Kor AirShell Wind Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: A great jacket for spring and fall running and hiking. I really like the feel of the material and the color. It is lightweight and packs up nicely to carry in a daypack. It will be a great windbreaker and I think it will also be good in light rain.
review.name: My go to windbreaker this spring

review.itemreviewed: Kor AirShell Wind Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Excellent jacket - stretchy, lightweight, and somehow still sturdy. I've been wearing it for running and it fits my needs perfectly. Appreciate the little reflective logo for these dark winter times. Plan to pack along on travels and as an extra layer for hiking. I'm 5'3'' // 125ish lbs // 36A and size small fits well with room for light layers, though I could likely have sized up to a medium for a little extra layering room.
review.name: Excellent jacket

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket. Fits well and I have had no issues. Not sure what the other reviews are saying, but that had no been my experience.

review.reviewBody: Having worn this jacket for 18 months the overall impression is poor.  The filling clumps together and no matter the amount of tumble drying it never was the same after first wash. hasVariant.description: Buy the Deuter Aircontact Core 65+10L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This backpack is made with quality. It goes around waist so that it keeps it it place while hiking. It has a ton of pockets to hold everything you’d want or need for a hike. The back it made so that you can keep good posture while walking without hurting your back.
review.name: Roomy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am really loving this backpack and all of the features that it has. I am a mom of multiple children and we do day hikes as well as overnight hikes. The biggest issue that I have with backpacks is being able to easily get things out of it throughout our hike without having to unpack everything. My favorite thing about this one is that there is a large zipper in the very front of the bag that allows me to open up the backpack almost as a door to get items. With this access point I am able to get items that are at the very bottom or the very top without having to take much extra out. This is especially great at lunchtime, I’m able to get everything I need out without having to do too much unpacking and repacking.  This has been a true game changer for us and I have not had that in any other packs. There are two fanny pack style compartments (hip belt pockets) that are located on the hip belt that I also use frequently for smaller frequently used items. The fit of this backpack is very comfortable and allows me to easily distribute the weight of the contents in the bag. This color is also nice as it does not show the dirt as easily as some of the light colors. The material feels and has been very durable and has a high quality look and functional feel to it! Overall I am very happy with this bag and would recommend for any skill level of hiker looking for a large capacity carrying bag!
review.name: I love this backpack and all of the features.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great back pack. I’ve used it twice. I’m carrying about 20 lbs without my water. Lots of room and adjustable depending on your height so if you are short like me, not an issue. Very comfortable. Love it so much
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I can honestly say that the Aircontact Core 65+10 is the best pack I have ever tried. Not only is it roomy but it is actually comfortable to wear. The lumbar support is amazing. I can basically pack EVERYTHING I could possibly need for camping in this pack and then some. Completely exceeded my expectations.
review.name: The BEST!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a top-notch hiking backpack!  I've had multiple bags, and this one is way superior to all the previous ones.  It is supper light, and extremely durable, the straps and back have superior ventilation setups, and the bottom has very durable fabric.  Zippers are high quality, and it looks like it will last for years to come
review.name: Amazing Quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product is excellent it came very well packaged and the color was so perfect and it was very soft and very big. I love it.  I have gotten so many compliments on it.   I will definitely recommend this product to anyone
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this for my hiking trip and I could not be happier this is top of the line quality,material,and comfort super easy to wear has many pouches and pockets super comfortable on long hikes ,it is very durable built extremely well, this is an excellent hiking pack
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Deuter Aircontact Core 65 + 10 Hiking Backpack is the greatest pack I’ve ever had and has helped while out hiking with all kinds of room and made very sturdy to withstand everything you pack. This pack carries a load really well and the padding feels great on my body, especially on hot days. It has good airflow and fits close to my back, which is how I like the fit. The access points are big enough to grab anything you might need from deep within and the removable top lid lets you drop some weight if you are going for a simple overnight hike or to just adventure. There is a lot to like or love on this pack. Being able to open the pack to get quick access to gear is very cool and being able to remove the top piece is cool as well to save weight on shorter trips which is a huge plus, if you don’t own a Deuter Aircontact Core 65 + 10 Hiking Backpack you’re missing out on a great adventure! Highly recommended for everyone!
review.name: Absolutely the best hiking pack ever!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag holds a lot and has many nifty pockets and features. Although advertised for women, the adjustable height works for teens. Good air flow and light materials. The straps could be more comfortable. They are lacking some padding, especially when the bag is packed full. Overall, nice quality for backpacking.
review.name: Aircontact Core 60+10SL

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Aircontact Core 60+10 SL is of exceptional quality.  I’m so impressed of the thoughtfulness of details and design.  From the curves on the shoulder and hip straps to the various attachment loops- so amazing.  It’s lightweight, comfortable, and durable.  By far the best pack I have owned.
review.name: No detail spared!

name: Aircontact Core 65+10L Backpack

review.reviewBody: You can tell that these knee guards are high quality and well thought out. I love the zipper feature which allows you to put them on right over your knee instead of having to pull them up over your foot. I found however that they run very small! I am 5'9", 140 lb female. So I am not petite but by no means am I large either. I was surprised at how tight and uncomfortable the size medium was for me, especially when the sizing is supposed to be unisex. I don't believe that even with stretching they would fit well enough and I had to return. Hopefully they work for others though!
review.name: Great quality but runs small

review.reviewBody: Great fit and super lightweight! I'm 6'6" and the XL size fits perfectly. Couldn't ask for better comfort and quality.
review.name: Great fit and supper light

review.reviewBody: Love the fit and feel of this. . . it's breathable and comfortable. . . and a little thicker fabric than expected but I like it. Size M is perfect at 5'10" 165lbs athletic build
review.name: Great fit and fabric

review.reviewBody: These shirts fit great, are comfortable with enough elasticity for easy movement. Great lightweight in the heat with sun protection. I own 3 of these now, and use them for hiking and other outdoor activities. Fantastic item!
review.name: Fantastic Shirt

review.reviewBody: I wore this recently while hiking in the alps. I used it as my first layer. The weather was cool but the hiking was strenuous. The shirt absorbs sweat well without odor. Its also very comfortable.
review.name: Works as advertised

review.reviewBody: Can't go wrong with this shirt. Good for all seasons outdoors.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: The shirt lives up to its billing of being a really comfortable shirt.  It feels great, stretches nicely, appropriately snug, etc.  My disappointment is its tendency to snag readily.  I haven’t worn it climbing or while doing any hard physical work, yet it has snagged in a couple of places which is a bummer.  Otherwise, five star.
review.name: Great shirt but one small snag…

review.reviewBody: This is a good shirt fits well the sleeves are short though for me.
review.name: This is a good shirt

review.reviewBody: I work in the high desert and spend most of the year in exposed environments with lots of dust & sun…this shirt has the best fit & feel out of the other brands I typically wear, and has a better color way too!
review.name: Best sun shirt I’ve ever owned

review.reviewBody: Bought this for hiking in the local So Cal mountains and this has far exceeded my expectations, looks good too for streetwear. Construction is great and the material is completely breathable, definitely will buy another for a reserve.
review.name: Perfect So Cal sun shirt...

review.reviewBody: Excellent fabric and cut - breathes and layers really well. 5’10” 160lbs & small fits well. Tundra colour a great change from black and blue!
review.name: Great hiking top

name: Alpenglow Crew Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: These shorts run true to size and fit great!  Patagonia sizes are somewhat inconsistent from time to time, but the size 2 fit the bill. I especially like the somewhat relaxed fit through the thighs and the pocket on the left upper thigh. That said, the inner short legs creep up and bunch at the groin.  I have a pair of Pataonia bike shorts from about 6 years ago with a liner that stays in place, so was expecting the same.  I will use my older liner with these shorts and will use this liner as a back-up pair.
review.name: Inner short rides up

review.reviewBody: Great shorts, typical Patagonia - great quality. Runs small like all bike clothing. I ordered a 14 and 16 to try on since bike clothes sizing is always so wonky. Sizes fit similarly but 16 much baggier on the leg/thigh area. I?ll be keeping the 14. (For reference I wear size 12 jeans at gap)
review.name: Great shorts

name: Dirt Craft Bike Short - Women's

hasVariant.name: Newport H2Sho Shoe - Little Kids'

review.reviewBody: Fabulous fit with heel cup and wide toe box over an excellent grippy sole which is perfect for zooming across playscapes and trails. Thank you.
review.name: Playscapes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] perfect footwear for a 4 1/2 yr. old grand daughter who loves to run and climb
review.name: Back to school shoes

review.reviewBody:
This shoe is for my 4yr old Grandson. They look and fit Fantastic. 
This is his 3rd pair of Keen Shoes. I also have Keen shoes.
He loves to show them off.
Great Quality. 
Will buy again.
review.name: Great Fit

review.reviewBody: My 5 yr. old grandson always gets his 7 yr. old twin brother's hand-me-downs. The only shoes that can be handed down are the Keen shoes I have pruchased for them, a little worse for wear but still in good shape. Decided the 5 yr. old needed a new pair for a change and he was thrilled to actually get a new pair and constantly showes everyone how fast he can run in his new Keens.
review.name: Great Shoes!

review.reviewBody: These smell after months and months. I don’t know what it is but both the ones we’ve worn and the next size waiting in the box still smell cloying and weird like perfumed tires. Great shoes for running around but my garage stinks of them and it makes them not enjoyable to wear. I thought it would go away but it’s still there. Ugh!!!
review.name: Weird smell right from the box

review.reviewBody: Nous avons acheté ce modèle il y a moins d'une semaine et la semelle glisse au fond du soulier et le tissu noir recouvrant la semelle commence à se décoller depuis hier. Cela faisait seulement 5 jours qu'il les avait !!!!
review.name: Semelle

review.reviewBody: I normally love Keen shoes and how durable they are for active, destructive boys. But this latest purchase, not three months in, and the Velcro no longer sticks, allowing you to tighten the shoe. Very frustrating. :-(
review.name: Crappy Velcro :(

name: Newport H2Sho Shoe - Little Kids'

review.reviewBody: I wore these for the first time on a 15-mile gravel ride last Monday, and they were incredibly comfortable in both the waist and tights. Unlike most bike shorts that feel tight around the thighs and don't look flattering, these fit perfectly and stay in place without rolling up. They're super comfortable! I highly recommend them and plan to wear them for mountain biking as well. SO HAPPY I FOUND THESE!
review.name: Perfect Fit!

review.reviewBody: These are the best liners. I am in love! I wear them by themselves gravel riding and road riding, but then throw some baggies over them and wear them as a liner. I am anywhere between a 8-12 in pants, and the L fits me perfectly. They are perfectly high-waisted and are super comfy. I need to get a second color in them ASAP.
review.name: Love these!

name: Biker Cham Liner Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So hard to find the perfect little stuff sack! I am happy to have found these and you cannot go wrong with them
review.name: Just what I needed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are perfect for foraging. They pack down small for when they are not in use. I carry them all so I can keep different items separate. The mesh allows spores to escape, which is nice for future foraging. There is a carrying strap on the bottom, and the top ties snuggly so nothing falls out. This is my second set, as I loved them so much I bought more.
review.name: I Love Them!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great product and the dimensions are accurate. I used it to hold my cook kit and it was important that it fit. I really like the quality of the materials of this stuff sack. It looks like it will be durable while still being lightweight. I highly recommend this stuff sack.
review.name: Lightweight and Durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very useful for camp utensils and camp food. Seem durable and nice to be able to clip multiple bags together.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Works well. It's nice to be able to see what's inside.
review.name: Works well. It's nice to

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like the convenience and efficiency of being able to see and identify what is in each sack without having to try to either remember or open the darn things and paw through the contents. These things are tough and durable, and if keeping things dry is an issue they can always easily be put in a dry bag. I am going to gradually transition to all mesh stuff sacks as my budget and sales permit.
review.name: Now I Wish ALL My Stuff Sacks Were Mesh!

name: Mesh Stuff Sack
