description: Buy the Black Diamond Snow Saw Guide online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Snow Saw Guide
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Snow Saw Guide online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love this 30cm lines on this. Saved time when digging pits.
review.name: Light and easy

review.reviewBody: On peut pas vrm se tromper, outils efficaces et pratiques. Il a tout ce que tu as besoin. Seul désavantage, il est un peu long avec sa poignée, ne rentre pas dans tous les sacs.
review.name: Recette gagnante

review.reviewBody: Haven’t used mine yet but I’ve been sharing with a friend of mine who’s had it for several years. The cord on the handle is great and I love the crystal chart and length measurements. Super light and great for anyone going into the mountains during winter.
review.name: Awesome & simple saw

review.reviewBody: Great snow saw, sheath isn’t my favorite but seems to hold fine so far. Like the handle with the ability to store cord
review.name: Snow saw

review.reviewBody: Very nice saw only complaint would be I wish the sheath was a little bit nicer, feels cheap.
review.name: SAW

review.reviewBody: Great saw for your winter backcountry kit. Everything you need in a snow saw and nothing you don’t.
review.name: Lightweight Perfection

review.reviewBody: I wanted a minimalist saw for a lightweight backcountry kit to stock a JetForce UL 26L pack. This saw is smaller than my other ones and is very light ~165g as advertised. Unfortunately, it just barely fits in the saw sleeve of the pack and is a struggle to zip up when the pack is loaded with a day's worth of gear. More a backpack problem than a saw problem; I may shorten the handle area with an angle grinder to make for more compact carry. The edge guard works okay for now, but relies on lateral grip of thin plastic that has no point guard at the end like the G3 model: when this gets to be a few seasons old I expect it won't stay on when sliding the saw into the pack.
review.name: Lightweight snow saw cuts columns

review.reviewBody: There’s a 30 cm mark, but I added marks for every 5 cm. Snow card area is small, but it works fine so long as it stays in the shade or snow. I don’t mind the angled handle, but I do prefer straight ones.
review.name: Small saw that doesn’t take up space

review.reviewBody: Comfortable handle and excellent sheath to guard against accidental cuts.
review.name: Snow Saw ~!

review.reviewBody: Pretty nice snow saw. String idea sounds nice but it’s really finicky to put back when you’re done with your pits. The saw is super light though and great build quality
review.name: Fine snow saw

name: Snow Saw Guide

review.reviewBody: This is hands down the most comfortable life jacket I have ever worn. It's easy to adjust to find the right fit, and once it's on, you forget you're wearing it. review.reviewBody: Color is really off, it’s more of a dark burnt orange than red. Nice quality hoodie though. What I didn’t appreciate was backcountry issuing a store credit refund instead of the original payment refund even though it met the original packaging and no tags removed standard for a full refund. Had to contact them directly and was told a ‘review’ needed to occur to make sure it was unused. All of that says to me is basically no one checked (or thought that I wouldn’t care) & just wanted to keep the money regardless of your own policy on refunds. Tack on the fact I was sent the wrong item when I originally ordered the hoodie, a women’s jacket, this whole experience has been pretty terrible.
review.name: Color is off

review.reviewBody:
Do not wear over a dark colored tee(see photo)
Also the white hoodie is whiter than the product photo. Not chalk white as expected
review.name: Warm enough but…

review.reviewBody:
Pros: Good tough material, fit is spot on, ergonomically terrific. I help coach a MTB team, and these are very comfortable to hang around in when we are sessioning things with the kids or doing some teaching. Also good for low effort or more gravity focused rides. 

Cons: I tend to run hot, and these pants are too hot for me from the mid 40s and warmer when riding technical New England trails. The material is a tad thick for my liking (they weigh almost 400 grams). I may be an anomaly in that regard, but if you also run hot, a lighter material with more ventilation would be better.
review.name: Thick and warm

review.reviewBody: Great fit, materials and construction. Done some aggressive riding in these, no apparent faults.
review.name: Just about perfect…

review.reviewBody:
I am a long term customer - so when i read "included bindings" I believed that. It is not correct, the mounting plates are there but no bindings. that could have been easily resolved by customer service but they had no interest in dealing with me; left me waiting, talked to a supervisor, said they needed to get back to me - and never did. So fact is, I could accept that it was a listing error but my contact with customer service was SO POOR, I am compelled to write this here! You had 3 weeks since we had contact, so this commentary is fair. 

SO - bindings are NOT included:)
review.name: ski 5, customer service 0

description: Buy the Magura USA MT Trail SL Brake Set online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: MT Trail SL Brake Set
hasVariant.description: Buy the Magura USA MT Trail SL Brake Set online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Takes about 20 tries to bleed if your lucky.   System super sensitive to air bubbles so expect brakes to feel spongy.    As a result of spongy feeling,  you end up squeezing the harder to stop.   Just get Codes or XTs - it will save your life.  LITERALLY.     Lever is now cracked at the hinge.   Forget their warranty department.  They won't even cover faulty brakes.     They want to charge $150 bucks for a flexi lever.
review.name: forget bleeding & bad customer service

review.reviewBody: These brakes and power and modulation better than Codes and XTRs only if you can bleed the.    Purchased the MT Trail SL.  4 pistons front, 2 piston rear.   It usually take 5 tries for the 4 piston but good luck with the 2 pistons.   What a disaster to bleed!
review.name: You will hate life bleeding these brakes

review.reviewBody:
The Magura MT Trail SL setup is my absolute favorite set of brakes for my last 3 mountain bikes!

The 4 piston front and 2 piston rear setup paired with 203's rotors provides more than enough stopping power and just the right amount of modulation.  What i like best about the Magura brakes is the smooth modulation & activation of the brake itself.   Easily customizable to suit your needs and preferences, how's that you ask...... Magura offers different types of levers with various types of adjustments, they also offer different colored inserts so if you don't want blue you can pick up red, pink, purple etc...   another interesting feature is that Magura  uses magnets to hold the brake pads against the pistons thus you'll never hear the brake pads rattling like some other brands. Magura brakes are also one of the easiest and cleanest (not spilling fluid everywhere) brakes to bleed and because they are mineral oil (Magura Blood) you won't have to  worry about your paint falling off due to the aggressive nature of brake fluid.   

I am a full Magura convert and even converted my wife to Magura brakes as well.
review.name: Nothing Better For Trail Riding

name: MT Trail SL Brake Set

review.reviewBody: I use my sandals for just about everything. I bike to work and use these sandals to keep cool during the hot Utah days. Not to mention they leave a sweet tan line on my feet. I do enjoy the fact that these are comfortable and don’t stink up like others. Sometimes I’ll just use these and switch over to my birkenstock. However I don’t necessarily hear the metal clip on the ground to many times so there’s no annoying way of walking. They are true to size and just a bit more. So make sure you use that when you’re choosing your size!
review.name: Great way to keep the summer cool!

review.reviewBody: Pricey but if they last the 10 years I expect like my last pair of inferior sandals than well worth it.
review.name: As good as it gets
